subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Russia retained its gold medal at the hockey world championship in Bern, Switzerland, beating Canada, 2-1, in a rematch of last year’s final. Oleg Saprykin had a tying power-play goal in the first period and Alex Radulov scored late in the second. The Ottawa Senators’ Jason Spezza gave Canada the early lead. Russia was unbeaten in the tournament despite trailing in six of nine games. Russia holds a 25-24 edge over Canada in world titles.
